page.title: 05Local History-Corsica Hall
page.content:
{Corsica Hall}
Corsica Hall is now the Seaford College of The training of Domestic Science Teachers.It stands where a cannon once defied would be enemies and where a mill peacefully ground its flour.It originally stood at Ringmer, near Lewes and it was built there by a notorious smuggler called Whitfield who smuggled wine from Corsica,but he presented it to George II "with some of his samples."This earned him a pardon,so he built a house and named it Corsica Hall.It was then bought by Lord Napier.Finally it was purchased by Mr.Harben,a clockmaker from Lewes It then became{Seaford College}but during the 2nd World War they were evacuated to Petworth.After the war it became the{Training College of {Domestic Science Teachers.}
